SEARCH
Package structures

Class SchedulePeriod

java.lang.Object
structures.SchedulePeriod
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<SchedulePeriod>
public class SchedulePeriod extends Object implements Comparable<SchedulePeriod>
The SchedulePeriod class hosts a series of constant values referring to ISCTE-IUL schedule time slots (start and end time), time periods (periods of a day, with start and end times), and days of the week. They are used to represent a user's time preferences when rescheduling a class, or when scheduling an entire new course.
Since:
1.0

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(SchedulePeriod o)
      Compares this SchedulePeriod with the specified SchedulePeriod for order. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this SchedulePeriod is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified SchedulePeriod. Comparison is based on the attributes of SchedulePeriod objects: - For time slots: compares based on start time. If start times are equal, compares based on end time. - For time periods: compares based on start time and end time. If both start and end times are less than the corresponding times in the specified SchedulePeriod, returns -1. If both are equal, returns 0. Otherwise, returns 1. - For days of the week: compares based on the DayOfWeek object.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<SchedulePeriod>
      Parameters:
      o - the SchedulePeriod to be compared
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this SchedulePeriod is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified SchedulePeriod

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns distinct string representations depending on if the SchedulePeriod object represents a timeslot, a time period, or a week day. The week day representation matches the format found in ISCTE-IUL schedule files.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String representing start and end time for time slots and periods, or first three letters of day name for week days
